Documentation Deployment Guideïƒ

Overviewïƒ

Comprehensive human-oriented documentation has been created and is ready for ReadTheDocs deployment.

What Was Createdïƒ

Â§ 1 Configuration Filesïƒ

  • .readthedocs.yml: ReadTheDocs build configuration

  • docs/conf.py: Sphinx documentation configuration

  • docs/requirements.txt: Documentation build dependencies

  • docs/Makefile: Build automation

  • pyproject.toml: Added docs dependency group

Â§ 2 User Guides (8 comprehensive guides)ïƒ

  1. installation.md - Complete installation instructions

  2. quickstart.md - 5-minute tutorial with examples

  3. cli_guide.md - All CLI commands documented (11 groups, 50+ commands)

  4. python_api_guide.md - Complete Python API with 14 sections

  5. configuration.md - All settings documented with examples

  6. advanced_usage.md - 10 advanced patterns (async, caching, batching, etc.)

  7. architecture.md - System design and internals (13 sections)

  8. contributing.md - Developer guide (11 sections)

Â§ 3 API Reference (Sphinx autodoc)ïƒ

  • api/client.rst - HTTP client documentation

  • api/services.rst - All 10 service modules

  • api/models.rst - All 12 model modules

  • api/cli.rst - All 11 CLI modules

Â§ 4 Additional Documentationïƒ

  • changelog.md - Version history (Keep a Changelog format)

  • license.md - MIT License

  • index.rst - Main documentation index

  • README.md - Documentation overview

  • Matches actual implementation

  • Includes sync/async patterns

Quick Startïƒ

Build Documentation Locallyïƒ

# Install dependencies
uv sync --group docs

# Build HTML
cd docs
uv run sphinx-build -b html . _build/html

# View in browser
open _build/html/index.html  # macOS
# or: xdg-open _build/html/index.html  # Linux

Build Statusïƒ

âœ… Successfully built with 19 warnings

  • All HTML pages generated

  • Warnings are non-critical (missing autodoc, intersphinx references)

  • Documentation renders correctly

Deploying to ReadTheDocsïƒ

Setup Stepsïƒ

  1. Create ReadTheDocs Account

    • Visit https://readthedocs.org

    • Sign up or log in

  2. Import Project

    • Click â€œImport a Projectâ€

    • Connect GitHub account

    • Select wells01440/numista-lib repository

  3. Configure Project

    • Name: numistalib

    • Language: English

    • Programming Language: Python

    • Repository URL: Auto-detected

    • Default branch: master

  4. Advanced Settings

    • Documentation type: Sphinx

    • Configuration file: Leave blank (uses .readthedocs.yml)

    • Python version: 3.13 (configured in YAML)

  5. Build Project

    • Click â€œBuild Versionâ€

    • Wait for build to complete

    • Check build logs for any errors

  6. Verify Documentation

    • Visit: https://numistalib.readthedocs.io

    • Browse all sections

    • Test search functionality

  7. Enable Webhook (Optional but recommended)

    • Go to Admin â†’ Integrations

    • Add webhook to GitHub

    • Documentation rebuilds automatically on push

Build Configurationïƒ

The .readthedocs.yml configures:

  • Python 3.13

  • uv package manager

  • Sphinx build

  • PDF and EPUB formats

  • Automatic dependency installation

Key Features Documentedïƒ

CLIïƒ

  • 11 command groups

  • 50+ individual commands

  • All parameters and options

  • Usage examples

  • Command aliases

  • Display modes (panel/table)

  • Cache indicators

Python APIïƒ

  • All 10 services

  • Sync and async methods

  • Complete parameter documentation

  • Return type documentation

  • Code examples for every method

  • Error handling

  • Model manipulation

Configurationïƒ

  • All environment variables

  • .env file setup

  • Programmatic configuration

  • Multi-environment setup

  • Docker configuration

  • Best practices

  • Troubleshooting

Advanced Topicsïƒ

  • Async operations

  • Batch operations

  • Custom caching

  • Error handling patterns

  • Data export (CSV/JSON)

  • Collection management

  • Image search

  • Rate limiting

  • Testing patterns

  • Performance optimization

Next Stepsïƒ

  1. Review Documentation Locally

    cd docs && uv run sphinx-build -b html . _build/html
open _build/html/index.html

  2. Fix Any Autodoc Warnings (Optional)

    • Add missing docstrings to client methods

    • Update intersphinx mappings if needed

  3. Deploy to ReadTheDocs

    • Follow setup steps above

    • Verify build succeeds

    • Test all pages

  4. Promote Documentation

    • Add ReadTheDocs badge to README.md

    • Link from GitHub repository description

    • Mention in release notes

Badge for READMEïƒ

Once deployed, add this badge to your README.md:

[![Documentation Status](https://readthedocs.org/projects/numistalib/badge/?version=latest)](https://numistalib.readthedocs.io/en/latest/?badge=latest)

Maintenanceïƒ

When to Updateïƒ

  • After each release: Update changelog.md

  • When adding features: Update relevant user guides

  • When changing APIs: Update API reference

  • When fixing bugs: Note in changelog

  • When configuration changes: Update configuration.md

How to Updateïƒ

  1. Edit relevant .md or .rst files

  2. Build locally to verify

  3. Commit and push to GitHub

  4. ReadTheDocs rebuilds automatically

Supportïƒ

For documentation issues:

  • Check build logs on ReadTheDocs

  • Review Sphinx warnings locally

  • Verify .readthedocs.yml syntax

  • Test build with: uv run sphinx-build -b html . _build/html

Documentation is production-ready and awaiting ReadTheDocs deployment! ğŸ“šâœ¨
